meanings.definition: Capable of being avoided or rejected.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise was shunnable, so I covered my ears.
meanings.sent2: She found the scary movie shunnable and decided not to watch it.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs may be shunnable to some, but it's common in other cultures.
meanings.sent4: His toxic behavior was a shunnable cloud hanging over their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The warning signs made the danger shunnable and clear to everyone.

meanings.definition: Deserving of being avoided or rejected.
meanings.sent1: The spoiled food was shunnable, so she threw it away.
meanings.sent2: His dishonest actions were shunnable, leading to his dismissal.
meanings.sent3: The idea of wearing socks with sandals is shunnable in the fashion world.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley looked shunnable, so they took a different route.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house had a shunnable aura that made people uneasy.
